intro: Meiogyne stipitata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mangrove, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small tree or shrub that typically grows in brackish or saline wetlands, adapting to coastal environments. The plant has smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing fragrant, yellowish blooms that attract various pollinators. Meiogyne stipitata plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
